learning_outcomes.description: Understand wood types, wood structure and its effect on timber properties.
Recognise the range of timber products (graded and engineered), applications, and wood processing systems.
Analyse and design structural timber elements (beams and columns), and timber structures.
Identify threats to the durability of timber structures and select suitable durability measures.
Understand the basic fire behaviour of timber and the fire performance of timber structures.
Apply design fundamentals to a real timber structure and communicate the design strategy for this structure.
Collaborate in groups with peers and learn from industry professionals.
Understand and apply with confidence national and international regulatory frameworks for the design of timber structures.
Critically analyse past failures of timber structures and develop safety and maintenance strategies to prevent such failures.

assessments.task_description:
A do-it-yourself durability lab that asks you to assess the durability of a timber structure of your choice.

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.category: Paper/ Report/ Annotation, Notebook/ Logbook, Participation/ Student contribution, Project
assessments.task_description:
This report details the design developed during the group project and the logbook outlines learnings from working with peers and industry professionals. Submission requirements and marking criteria will be made available on Blackboard.

Anonymous peer assessment will be used to weight individual marks. Formative peer assessment will be available at project mid-point to help manage potential conflict.

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Group project presentation to peers and external judges. Submission requirements and marking criteria will be made available on Blackboard. Presentations will be recorded for marking purposes if required. Recordings will be stored and treated with confidence. Recordings will be retained for at least 1 year after the release of course grades. Recordings will only be accessed for the purpose of moderation of marking; provision of feedback; or re-marking following a successful re-mark application.

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.

assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
The final exam will be a Gradescope exam and include a combination of multiple-choice, short answer and problem solving questions.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
